Package com.algorand.algosdk.crypto

Class Address

java.lang.Object
com.algorand.algosdk.crypto.Address
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Address
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
Address represents a serializable 32-byte length Algorand address.
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Field Details

    • LEN_BYTES

      public static final int LEN_BYTES
      The length of an address. Equal to the size of a SHA256 checksum.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

      public static final byte[] APP_ID_PREFIX

  • Method Details

    • getBytes

      public byte[] getBytes()
      Get the underlying bytes wrapped by this Address.
      Returns:
      32 byte array

    • encodeAsString

      public java.lang.String encodeAsString() throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
      encodeAsString converts the address to a human-readable representation, with a 4-byte checksum appended at the end, using SHA256. Note that string representations of addresses generated by different SDKs may not be compatible.
      Returns:
      Throws:
      java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException

    • verifyBytes

      public boolean verifyBytes​(byte[] message, Signature signature) throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException, java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException, java.security.InvalidKeyException, java.security.SignatureException
      verifyBytes verifies that the signature for the message is valid for the public key. The message should have been prepended with "MX" when signing.
      Parameters:
      message - the message that was signed
      signature -
      Returns:
      boolean; true if the signature is valid
      Throws:
      java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
      java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException
      java.security.InvalidKeyException
      java.security.SignatureException

    • toVerifyKey

      public java.security.PublicKey toVerifyKey() throws java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException, java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
      toVerifyKey returns address' public key in a form suitable for java.security.Signature.initVerify
      Returns:
      PublicKey
      Throws:
      java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException
      java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException

      Overrides:

    • compareTo

      public boolean compareTo​(java.lang.String address)

    • forApplication

      public static Address forApplication​(long appID) throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException, java.io.IOException
      Get the escrow address of an application.
      Parameters:
      appID - The ID of the application.
      Returns:
      The address corresponding to that application's escrow account.
      Throws:
      java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
      java.io.IOException
